meanings.definition: The quality of being able to persuade or convince others.
meanings.sent1: Her persuasiveness in convincing the team to try a new strategy was impressive.
meanings.sent2: His natural persuasiveness made him a successful salesman.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to use its persuasiveness to convince the dog to share its toy.
meanings.sent4: The artist's painting had a certain persuasiveness that drew viewers in.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's persuasiveness in explaining complex concepts made learning easier for the students.

meanings.definition: The act of persuading or influencing someone to do or believe something.
meanings.sent1: The persuasiveness of her argument swayed the jury in her favor.
meanings.sent2: Political campaigns often rely on the persuasiveness of their messages to win votes.
meanings.sent3: The magician's persuasiveness made the audience believe in his impossible tricks.
meanings.sent4: The persuasiveness of the advertisement made everyone rush to buy the product.
meanings.sent5: His persuasiveness in getting his friends to join him on the adventure was unmatched.
